Package com.salesforce.multicloudj.docstore.client

Class Query

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.multicloudj.docstore.client.Query
  • public class Query
extends Object
    Query provides a fluent interface for building and executing queries against document stores.

    This class allows you to construct complex queries with filtering, sorting, pagination, and field selection capabilities across multiple cloud providers including AWS DynamoDB, GCP Firestore, and Alibaba TableStore.

    The Query class supports:

    • Filtering with various operations (EQUAL, GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN, IN, etc.)
    • Sorting by field with ascending/descending order
    • Pagination with offset and limit
    • Field projection to retrieve only specific fields
    • Pre-query callbacks for custom processing, not supported yet

    Usage example: 

     DocStoreClient client = DocStoreClient.builder("aws").build();
 
 // Simple query with filtering
 DocumentIterator results = client.query()
     .where("age", FilterOperation.GREATER_THAN, 25)
     .where("status", FilterOperation.EQUAL, "active")
     .limit(10)
     .orderBy("name", true)
     .get();
 
 // Process results
       Person p = new Person();
       while (iter.hasNext()) {
           iter.next(new Document(p));
           System.out.println(p);
       }

    Note: Multiple filters are combined using AND logic. When using orderBy, the order field must appear in at least one where clause.

    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • Query

        public Query​(AbstractDocStore docStore)
        Creates a new Query instance for the specified document store.
        Parameters:
        docStore - the document store implementation to query against

    • Method Detail

      • where

        public Query where​(String fieldPath,
                   FilterOperation op,
                   Object value)
        Adds a filter condition to the query. Multiple where clauses are combined with AND logic.

        Supported operations include:

        • EQUAL - exact match for strings, numbers
        • GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN - comparison for numbers and strings
        • GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO, LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO - inclusive comparisons
        • IN, NOT_IN - membership testing with collections

        Field paths can use dot notation to access nested fields (e.g., "user.profile.age").

        Parameters:
        fieldPath - the field path to filter on, supports dot notation for nested fields
        op - the filter operation to apply
        value - the value to compare against. For IN/NOT_IN operations, should be a Collection
        Returns:
        this Query instance for method chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if fieldPath is invalid, operation is unsupported, or value type is incompatible with the operation

      • offset

        public Query offset​(int n)
        Sets the number of results to skip before returning results. This is useful for pagination when combined with limit().

        When offset is 0 or negative, no results are skipped. Only one offset clause is allowed per query.

        Parameters:
        n - the number of results to skip, must be non-negative
        Returns:
        this Query instance for method chaining

      • limit

        public Query limit​(int n)
        Sets the maximum number of results to return. This is useful for pagination and performance optimization.

        When limit is 0 or negative, all possible results are returned. Only one limit clause is allowed per query.

        Parameters:
        n - the maximum number of results to return, must be greater than zero
        Returns:
        this Query instance for method chaining

      • orderBy

        public Query orderBy​(String fieldName,
                     boolean orderAscending)
        Sets the field to use for sorting the query results.

        Important: The orderBy field must appear in at least one where clause to ensure efficient query execution across different cloud providers. Only one orderBy clause is allowed per query.

        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field name to sort by, must not be null
        orderAscending - true for ascending order, false for descending order
        Returns:
        this Query instance for method chaining

      • beforeQuery

        public Query beforeQuery​(Consumer<Predicate<Object>> beforeQuery)
        Sets a callback function to be executed before the query runs. This allows for driver-specific customizations and advanced query modifications.

        The callback receives a Predicate that can be used to test for driver-specific types and capabilities, enabling conditional logic based on the underlying provider.

        Parameters:
        beforeQuery - the callback function to execute before running the query
        Returns:
        this Query instance for method chaining

      • get

        public DocumentIterator get​(String... fieldPath)
        Executes the query and returns an iterator over the matching documents.

        This method applies all the configured filters, sorting, pagination, and field selection to retrieve documents from the document store. The results are returned as a DocumentIterator that allows for efficient iteration over potentially large result sets.

        If specific field paths are provided, only those fields will be retrieved from each document. Field paths support dot notation for accessing nested fields (e.g., "user.profile.name").

        Parameters:
        fieldPath - optional field paths to retrieve. If not provided, all fields are retrieved
        Returns:
        a DocumentIterator for iterating over the query results

      • initGet

        public void initGet​(List<String> fieldPaths)
        Initializes the query for execution by validating field paths and query constraints.

        This method performs several validation checks:

        • Ensures the document store is not closed
        • Validates all field paths are properly formatted
        • Ensures orderBy field appears in at least one where clause (if both are specified)
        Parameters:
        fieldPaths - the list of field paths to retrieve
